author: sky.cactus
content: There are clients written in a variety of languages.  One option would be to pick a language you are most familiar with and start with a client written in that.  Also, the space of "Ethereum development" is quite large, so I recommend picking a small sliver to start with and focus on that.

author: codexpert.007
content: <@301186049323958275> Thanks for your kind reply. I am comfortable with Go as well as Rust. Can you please give me some idea on sub-topic I should focus on? Thanks a lot! ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: Look into geth (go-ethereum) and Erigon if you want to do client dev.  I think one of the consensus layer clients may also be in rust or go (not sure what language they are all written in).

author: pietjepuk
content: Lighthouse is Rust, Prysm is Go

content: Hello, where can I find some documentation on how CL and EL interacts, and what exactly the purpose of the Engine API is? I've read the Engine API specs, but I fail to understand the workflow
